page.title: 02Warsop Parish Church.
page.content: The church of S.S.Peter and Paul in the North West of the block occupies a good position being built on a hill to the north of the river overlooking the town.It is probably built on the foundations of an earlier wooden Saxon church,none of which remains.The church today shows much Norman architecture,in particular a large dog-tooth archway at the base of the tower,but over the years the church has been restored and parts rebuilt.It has some lovely stained glass windows and a wooden roof.It has also an angel holding a candle which was carved by a German prisoner of war. On the outside of the building many gargoyles can be seen.A graveyard surrounds the church and the oldest gravestone is dated 1642.
